alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 5:27AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following counties, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Waldo. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 AM EST, An inch to an inch and a half of rain has fallen in the region with more precipitation expected this morning. This rain will combine with snowmelt to produce localized flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Augusta, Rockland, Belfast, Gardiner, Camden, Damariscotta, Lincolnville, Thorndike, Searsport and Wiscasset.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
